description:
Now the only Starbucks in the Castro. This Starbucks is very pro LGBT friendly. It's a smaller location with minimal seating. Service is friendly and they are quick. Homeless and cleanliness seem to be a continual issue. 

Parking is easy on the street early in the morning, but the neighborhood gets busy most afternoons and evenings.
author: Alan H.

description:
This used to be such a fun spot, back when I used to visit San Francisco on a regular bases, back before we had real big problems with homeless issues, well those days are gone!

Tonight, I came in for another regular visit at the Castro district, as usual I ordered and got my drink rather swiftly, then I turn around and noticed how crowded this place have become, though I noticed something were off about some of the patrons that were seating/semi sliding down their seats, it wasn't until I found an unoccupied chair to sit down then I realised "some of these people" have bags after bags of their clothes and other possessions with them, some of them talk to themselves while other just stared at me like a zombie! 

And if you're like me who have issues with body odour, trust me you will not like this place!
author: Skyler Z.

description: I ordered the same thing I always order, a venti Black Tea Lemonade with three pumps of raspberry and it taste the same as every other Starbucks but the experience and friendliness makes this my favorite Starbucks! There are pride flags on the wall that you can sign and every time I come in the staff is super friendly and upbeat, Whitney Houston playing also upped the rating because the whole cafe was singing or at least swaying with the beat
author: Libby M.

description: For the last several months when I come to this location there is ALWAYS an issue. Either my drink is made wrong, it's not ready on time after ordering on the mobile app, they are not open on time or they are too busy talking to each other and or friends standing at the bar. The service at this location has gone extremely downhill. I would prefer to go to Castro Coffee Company. Too bad they don't open earlier.
author: Ayana K.

description:
I'm back reviewing my 4th Starbucks of the Bay Area. Only 86 more to go (I googled it). If you know me or have followed me on yelp long enough, you'd know that I'm obsessed with Starbucks. This Castro location is definitely one of my favorites.

Castro Starbucks is no different than the other ones in terms of their drinks. It's your standard frappuccinos, lattes, and teas. The service here has always been friendly when I've been here. Some employees are also eye candies, so that helps. Though, on occasion I do get the "sassy gay" who has no R-E-S-P-E-C-T. You better listen to Aretha.

I think for the most part, the location of this Starbucks is why it's my favorite. I mean, it's in the heart of Castro District! The view is amazing. Overlooking the rainbow colors and different people walking by. On a good sunny day I enjoy getting a cold drink and walking around the area with my boyfriend. Or even at night, seeing all the people party it up! 

The layout is a little too small, but everyone seems to be on-the-go nowadays, so it doesn't really matter. 

I can't really tell anyone to go to Castro just for a damn latte, but it's definitely a great location for a Starbucks. More than anything, I love this place because it's in the Castro District. Basic, standard Starbucks, with a great and historical front yard!

Again, my name is Oliver, and I am a Starbucks addict.
author: Oliver B.

description: Mobile ordering hasn't work for some time now and I just called (literally at 12:28pm)and a female answered the phone and said its down and hung up. So rude an inconvenient! I live a block away and it use to be convenient  buying $6.45 a coffee daily before work. You guys are a joke! And its not busy
author: Lynton M.

description:
A sign that says, "Only available if you believe," sat and judged me while I approached the barista with a look of shame on my face. You'd think the first thing out of my mouth would have been a phrase of acknowledgment, but instead I said, "Please, don't hate me."

While the #unicorn phenom is currently taking Instagram by storm (because you know, #eatingfortheinsta), Starbucks was smart to bank in on it. Of course, the demographic is primarily young girls. Imagine the barista's surprise when a 30-year-old, brown, round, woman with grey hairs ordered up this limited edition sugary drink. I watched while the pissed off barista started on the Unicorn. It was a lot less involved than I anticipated. A little bit of milk, some raspberry-colored powder, some pumps of flavoring, a long squirt of blue gunk on the inside rim of the cup, a blitz in the Vitamix, topped with whipped cream and a sprinkling of fairy dust. Boom. I opted for the small. But, the obviously unteenaged dude behind me, went balls out and ordered a large. I was impressed.

And sugary it was. I only lasted five sips of this skittles-flavored concoction before I passed out in my GTI from a diabetic coma. When I came to, I puked a rainbow on the sidewalk.
author: Illyanna M.

description:
This is my local starbucks and it's THE WORST!! The staff working here is incredibly slow and more interested in hanging out than working. I have placed mobile orders ten minutes before walking over and still had to wait. If you are in a hurry you will be better off getting a red bull at walgreens. Also they have tons of attitude, maybe because it's the Castro? Not sure. 
I would also like to mention that I'm a barber and in the customer service industry. This review is six months in the making, and in no way based on a one time experience.
author: Marc E.

description:
Do not go here!! Went early in the AM, several people actively using drugs (appeared to be a meth pipe), and engaging in drug transactions, directly infront of the store, and passing around electronic items (stolen?).

They appeared to have set up there.  Lighting was very poor outside.  People should have safety concerns.  Sidewalk needed to be hosed down very badly.  Do not go here!!!
author: Luke B.

description:
I've been here many times over the years. I enjoy their iced soy lattees. Tonight, I had the distinct displeasure of being on the oppressed end of ageism. Never have I frequented an establishment whereby all three who came in contact with me, were ruder than the barista before him. I was never spoken to, only at, and then only if it was necessary.

I will never support this Starbucks with one dime of my money ever again.
author: John N.

description: Every single time I walk in this location I am met with rude and unhappy employees.  Always mess up my order then I get attitude when I want it right. Especially Marko he is one one rudest and most unhappy people working there.  If you don't like what you're doing then find something else.  Thanks for ruining a few minutes of my morning.  I'll go somewhere else when I am out here from now on.
author: Eric N.

description:
It's not too often that I drink coffee, so I'm not a "coffee snob". That being said, I actually enjoy going to this particular Starbucks. The clientele are friendly, the baristas are very nice & actually seem to care about you as a customer, and most importantly, it's clean. 
There are many options in the Castro for coffee, but I just like the vibe at (this) Starbucks better.
author: Reed S.

description: As a retired Starbucks partner I am very critical of my experience when I visit a store. My husband and I were at this location on the morning of August 3rd. We were greeted with a smile and acknowledgement from the guy at the register, as was everyone else. The store was busy as everyone working was chatting with regular customers as they were doing their jobs. We love the diversity of this area and find it charming. Yes it is not in the best part of town and there were a lot of homeless, but that is evident in every city in the US now.
author: Kathleen F.

description: Normal coffee. Bitter employees. Unhygienic store. This store used to be great, and I love the Castro and the lively locals, but something happened. It doesn't feel the same.
author: Colby M.

description:
Well, Starbucks in the Castro isn't exactly a Harvey Milk landmark but they do make a mean tea latte and you won't get no guff from me about the free WiFi either. 

Just a quarter block off the main strip they'll make a Divine cup o tea and let you use their restrooms when you realize there's 5843684368 million tears in your tights before a big drag show you were trying to not look a fool for.
author: Candice G.

description: I just love my Fitbit, it's so easy to simply go into a Starbucks to quickly pay for my cup of grounded up coffee beans from my Fitbit smartwatch!
author: Sami S.

description:
Smells like a urine
Staff is unproductive, chat with each other too much while customers wait
author: H O.

description:
Wow they open at 5 a.m.!!!

There appear to be a number
of regular customers in the early hours, and the staff gives them priority which is irritating if you're not a regular. I'm about to become a regular, so too bad all of you infrequent early risers...nya nya nya I'm gonna get my caffeine fix before all y'all!
:)
author: El B.

description: Oh I love this place - I have been coming in most days for about seven months and all the staff are always super friendly and smiling.
author: Trev O.

description: I have never been to a Starbucks so disgusting looking in my entire life! The floors are dirty and sticky the garbage was over flowing and the bathroom my god was disgusting!!!!!! I worked at Starbucks when I was about 17 years old and we always kept bathrooms monitored and cleaned. This was DIDGUSTING floor was so nasty urine all over toilet and floor blood on floor near toilet and it had nomore soap I had to wait 6 min for soap to be replaced and they had an Attitude about it!!!!' Unbelievable never again. DO NOT I REPEAT DO NOT VISIT THIS STARBUCKS EVER!
author: Zoa M.

description: I have been to Starbucks on numerous occasions and I can honestly say that I make better coffee at home. I have had several of their coffees from their iced latte to the caramel cocoa cluster frappuccino. For some reason it always tastes different, I guess a barista is obviously messing up. You can definitely get better at a small cafe with even a friendly easy-going environment to accompany each cup. If you're looking for a corner to chill, this is not your place because it is always busy and always noisy.
author: Lupe T.

description:
Yeah so ummm bumping this down to two stars. This place is constantly dirty, the furniture is uncomfortable, they've removed all the electrical outlets, the cell phone charging stations don't work anymore, there is an endless stream of deplorables wandering in and out at all hours, the air conditioning has been broken for months and it's super hot in the store, etc.. This place literally feels unsafe sometimes and is in disrepair. Such a shame. Place used to be a community hangout.

Two stars cause, well, it's a coffee place, and they still have coffee I guess. And free WiFi.
author: Darren S.

description: Most of the employees are really nice and charming. They always make eye contact and smile at me as I placed the order. Can't complain about that. They are genuine and attentive and never had a problem till last week. I got a Latte and it was watery -- imagine a Latte made with regular coffee instead espresso. Today I came back and had the same problem. So far I have not said anything because they are good people. I wonder if there is a problem with the espresso machine or the barista has forgotten how to make coffee drinks. Hope this is fixed soon, I am still looking forward to coming back and get an OK Latte.
author: Rocio M.

description:
Oh my dear god! 
The best staffs EVER in any coffee shops in the world WHICH people working here CARE!!
THEY ARE VERY FRIENDLY!!
THEY ARE THE BEST!!
My friend just be aware of using the mobile app in MUNI underground!! It happens to me twice that it CHARGES me twice for same order.
THANK YOU AGAIN for the lovely staffs in this location!!
#best staffs #Starbucks #the best
author: Savio Y.

description:
Today 8/24/16 3:30pm I always stop at this location when I'm in the Castro. There is a Lady who works the counter who is the rudest person I have ever had the displeasure of waiting on me. She has short brown hair. I don't know her name sense she never wears a name tag. Probably because she's rude to everyone and doesn't want anyone to know her name. She also gets upset when I'm polite and say yes ma'am. I have had her turn around wait on me without saying a word. Ask me to pay then she turns around and fails to get my drink ready.
Then I stand there waiting while the people after me is being served.
I always give a dollar tip every time I stop in for coffee. I WILL NEVER TIP THE WOMAN AGAIN!!
I can't believe the service she gives.
author: Lawrence G.

description: Good local Starbucks. Staff is friendly and drinks are good. Wish it had more of a seating area but it is a very small location.
author: Robbert G.

description: Bathroom very dirty...ran out of caramel... staff were all very  nice. Just not enough employees to run well.
author: The C.

description: While this location didn't have the acai tea to make the newly dubbed "Pink Drink", the baristas gave it their best shot and made the drink with raspberry instead. It turned out quite well. I finally tried the smores frap as well. Good, but I'll stick to my caramels and chocolates.
author: Joshua F.

description: Worst Starbucks I've ever been to.  I ordered the special for $5 coffee and sandwich.  No one knew what it was.  Though posted in the window.  So slow terrible service! First time here and last time for sure!
author: Sheila P.

description: Great coffee and the staff was very friendly. The line was the normal slower line. Overall it was good. The workers were all very friendly, had great customer service skills and got the drinks made in a timely fashion. Keep up the good work!
author: Big D.

description:
It's like every latte I get here has been touched by an Angel. 
Best Starbucks in the world.
author: Charles E.

description: The bathroom is absolutely disgusting. Very poor customer service. Will never come back ever again.
author: Brooklyn T.

description:
I've been to Starbucks in several locations in northern and central California. This location distinguishes itself by making a high rate of errors with pricing, drink ingredients, and refill policy. The one star is for the friendly customers.

This is a small location with as many seats as it can hold, but empty seats are hard to find. And if there's a line for the bathroom, the place gets uncomfortably crowded.
author: Brett N.

description:
Open late till 11pm - sweet!

In  the Castro, Philz is my goto place for coffee.  But since this Starbucks is open late and when we come here for dinner, it's not a bad alternative hangout to chill and savor cappuccino and lates and catch up with friends.

This location got a makeover.  Looks like it got expanded and their WC is now located to the left instead of having to go way back towards their employee break room.  They also added a couple of rectangular tables to accommodate the laptop users who needs to stay longer than the average customer.  

Staff here have always been kind and quick.

There is a small bench right outside.  I don't recommend it since the sidewalk is narrow unless you want your foot stepped on - your choice!
author: Edwin R.

description:
Disgusting. Burnt, horrible taste. I ordered a latte, how did they burn it, were the beans already burned? Is it a fluke? or do their patrons like bitter, char-roasted coffee?
Full disclosure - I'm not a Starbucks fan. This is the city, Philz is #1 for me, from there a handful of great coffee places, then Peet's, then maybe if someone get's me a gift card for Xmas will I choose Starbucks. 
Ok, so I had to use my card, why not? I used to drink Starbucks in my college years, before I developed a palate and a nose for good coffee. Simple order, a Grande Latte w/ coconut milk. One sip, there was a very bitter aftertaste. Another sip, it was clearly burnt. If you have ever burned beans you know the smell and the taste. Yuk. Sadly I was walking and by the time I got my dog leash, bag, coffee juggling in hand and had my second sip I was already a block away. By two blocks, it was clear I would not, could not drink it. What a waste, Now what to do with the remaining $20 on my card. :(
Note - the Barista was the sweetest. I really wish I had a good experience, the staff was so nice!
author: Yolanda I.

description:
This is essentially the living room of the castro. That means you get the good, the bad, and the sometimes desperate. But overall, there is a good, communal
vibe and it's always interesting people watching. The workers here are consistently cheerful and helpful, which is pretty amazing given the huge volume of customers they serve. Wifi is consistently strong BUT I often have a hard time logging on and other customers have mentioned it is tricky for them, as well.
author: SF R.

description:
Had a MARVELOUS experience here during the Oprah Chai Tea Launch. I had gone in for Afternoon Tea & ordered my usual iced tea with milk & managed to sit down when Barista AMIRA came round sampling Oprah's new tea! We had a lovely chat about the new Oprah Chai Tea & she made me one on the house. I was so impressed by her & how friendly, confident, & knowledgeable and keen she was! I'll definitely be back to look for this Barista! She was incredibly keen, well mannered, and savvy! The service I received was spot-on-first-class & she is so professional & talented behind the Coffee bar!

This Starbucks is so conveniently located, I wish it were a lot bigger. Its close to my Pharmacy, the Post Office, Castro Country Club, Eureka Valley Rec Centre, Daddy's & other businesses!

The staff are lovely, for the most part, I just dislike it when people who are not customers come in to use the restrooms, they ought to not be public. Also be wary when requesting refills on Tea because one of the Baristas Can(can't remember her name) gets VERY cross when you request a new Tea bag, regretfully.
author: Julian I.

description: Starbucks is Starbucks. I'm just chronically disappointed with the service I receive here. From being told I look completely joyless to being forced to wait for employees to finish personal conversations before assisting me, I'm not sure why I frequent this place.
author: Joseph R.

description: Starbucks in Castro!  This location is a bit small.  Baristas are friendly enough.  A typical average Starbucks experience.  There's a restroom and outlets to recharge your electronics yay!  Nothing more worth mentioning :)
author: Betty H.

description:
They remodeled? Didn't notice. Despite the space being cramped and seating arrangements awkward, I actually find this place quite quaint. 

The workers here have a great sense of humor and can always strike up a good conversation. Plus whenever i order my Iced caramel macchiato with extra caramel, they really do put extraaaa caramel. I love it.
author: Anh T.

description: They are constantly rude, there bathroom policy is atrocious, they forget simple modifications to orders, they pay little attention to the customer and more attention to conversing with one another and guests.  I frequent Starbucks  over the city, sometimes twice a day in SF, this is consistently the worst location.  Starbucks is a well oiled corporation with the same product, further the only reason this location can be so pathetic is the unpleasant customer service that these starbucks employees embody, never again, too many other good locations and coffee shops in SF.
author: Josh M.

description:
Some dude who frequents this place called me FAT.  Yes, FAT!

I hinted he looked older than he thought he could get away with.

He said I was being mean to get back at him.  Well.  Played.  

But dude was hella delusional because he looked mid-40s (and of the variety that didn't appeal to me because I do like older men) and he thought he looked early 30s.  I don't argue with crazies and a deluded gay man can be crazy times bigillion.  

Game lost.  Sanity retained.  

Gay tip: A Lewis Carroll nonsense verse can make sense when you break down the sentence mechanics.  A nonsensical gay dude will not make sense even if you can break down the mysteries of the universe.  Just walk away!

Man, you have to be on guard at this StarBears/Bearbucks.  I'm game for a word shoot out but not before noon!  And never with a crazy.  

It's also no Philz Coffee, 2 stars in comparison.  Philz all the way!
author: Phillip N.

description: The staff recently started to enforce the "no vagrants / squatters" rule and things are getting more "normal" in this place.  It's too bad the staff needs to also play Security, but at least they're putting the patrons first.
author: David S.

description:
Castro Castro Castro! 

I love Starbucks. This location is on the tiny side and crammed with Castro folks. I love that the bathroom doesn't have a code. Its super clan too (I didn't expect a clean bathroom in Castro).

Tried the vanilla spice iced latte. It was just ok. I'll stick with everything else except for that drink.
author: Court S.

description: One of the gay meccas of the Castro, this Starbucks is newly remodeled and a great spot for a quick pick me up. No pun intended. Great Barista staff, friendly, fast and know their drink standards well. Bathroom line gets a bit long, so be prepared to wait. Lobby seating is nice for studying or an early afternoon news session. There is limited outdoor seating, but if your patient its a great spot to watch the bustle and enjoy your sandwich or pastry.
author: Tanner D.

description:
I was doing some work with local pet-friendly businesses in the Castro today and realized that I showed up before most places opened.  Instead, I walked over to the Starbucks near the corner and dropped in and hang out for a bit.

I had a coupon for a free Perfect Oatmeal and it was the last day to claim it so that's just what I did.  It came with brown sugar, nuts, and dried fruits to drop in and mix and together the ingredients really did whip up a great oatmeal breakfast.

This particular location seems to be super pet-friendly and besides the comfy outdoor benches where people shack up with their dogs, many also bring their small dogs inside while ordering.  While not officially endorsed, people around here all love dogs so it seems A-OK to do it.  There's plenty of seating inside near outlets and people are really friendly.  Great location to bring your pup, so do it!

Food: 8/10

Service: 8/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 8/10
author: Joe M.

description: The staff is very friendly and up beat. Especially for 530AM. I normally get hot tea, but lately for some reason I get a tall hot soy chocolate milk.
author: Vinson H.

description: This place was great before, but the new staffing is not on top of it's game and they no longer have tables in front.  Today they couldn't even unlock the few bench seats they have because THE key was lost.  God forbid you have an extra key when you are a half block from Cliff's Hardware.
author: Chuck Y.

description: What's to say, it's Starbucks. Got a $25 gift card in exchange for doing a random good deed and it's not tapped out yet. Decent soy lattes.
author: Kristina B.

description:
Bearbucks?  Lol @ Jim G.'s review.  I will say that when we ducked into this friendly small shop on a chock-full-day of touristing, we found most of the seats taken by guys who just liked to hang out on a Saturday afternoon at Starbucks.  Really, I mean you live in damn SAN FRANCISCO, people.  I know you're in the Castro and so you've arrived and all, but there have to be better places to be on a Saturday afternoon, especially one as lovely as the day we were there.

We got some drinks, charged the smartphones for a bit, and headed out.

PS  Cell reception in here...not awesome.
author: Stephen H.

description: The service let me say is really nice! They're kind and really helpful! Im hamppy to say hat the drinks are also made better than most of the starbucks I've been to, its not watery and the pricing although is pretty much the same though. If youre looking for REAL coffee however go to a nearby coffee shop instead like Peets or something.
author: Lena T.

description: Five stars for being the beariest of Bearbucks!
author: Jessica L.

description: I LOVE THIS TEAM. They make my morning..every morning! Such warm people here. And they've memorized the two drinks I switch off with so by the time I reach the counter, it's rung up. You're the best, guys. Thanks for keeping me awake during work.
author: Kat D.

description:
Starbucks is starbucks. Tazo is decent and coffee is bland (from what I've heard.) But what I really like about this location is the late hour hours. One recent weekend, my girlfriend and I were walking around the vicinity trying to find a cafe that to spend some time in before moving on to bars. But all the places we would normally have gone to in the Mission were closed! It was only 9pm! Fortunately, Starbucks on Castro was open until 11pm. 

So if you're like me, and sometimes need a little caffeine before you start your night out, here's a helpful option.
author: Jon T.

description:
Haha. EVERYONE calls this Bearbucks, that's too funny. I thought that my corny friend was just trying to make a funny.

Bottom line: It's a Starbucks with everything that comes with a Starbucks ringing true for this place. Same menu, same options, same vibe. Except that there are 40-50something year old men and lots of dogs out front. Fair enough.

The servers are friendly, the food and service are predictable, and the location can't be beat.
author: Sean B.

description:
This is my favorite Starbucks in the whole whole world!!  Because it's 4 blocks from my house, and the people who work here are really nice!  And they caught on to the fact that I get a grande coffee every time I go in (though I do switch up whether I do the light or dark roast)... So they are ready to execute as soon as they see me!

But, if I were to really, truly compare this to other Starbucks, how does it do?  Pretty good.  Because the line's never very long (they have 5 people working there in the morning!), they almost almost always have something besides Pike Place roast on drip (I can't stand Pike Place), and it's usually clean.

Which Starbucks are better?  The one on Bryant in Inner Mission is really nice... the people are friendly there too, there's a ton of space to sit, and they have a Clover machine!!  With all the Starbucks Reserve coffees!!  Oh, how much I love Starbucks Reserve...

Which Starbucks are worse?  The one on Fulton in Western Addition.  They once had only Pike Place on drip and the dude serving me REFUSED to to a single-brew of it because he personally despised that brewing technique (note: Every other Starbucks I've been to has happily made single-cups).  And the one on Market in the Safeway complex, in Castro.  That place is so friggen dirty all the time, the staff is mean, and they suck at making coffee.  I don't know how they suck at it, it seems pretty easy, but they're often out of things and other times their coffee isn't quite right.

OK, very long-winded review of just ONE Starbucks... but again, 18th St Starbucks is great, I'm really happy to have it in my neighborhood.
author: Jon E.

description:
After walking around Dolores Park, I needed to use the bathroom. Of course, Starbucks are the pedestrian version of the highway rest stop - a place for a clean bathroom and a shot of caffeine. 

Quaint, quiet, and full of the locals from they gayborhood. Apparently a good spot to go look for a "bear?"
author: Jake K.

description: Seriously some sassy service here.  I got a snap and eye roll from one of the servers when I tried to order a $2 orange refresher incorrectly.  Geez... I ended up with a coffee instead.  Then I got mad when I walked across the street and saw Philz coffee...wish I got my coffee fix there instead.  I bet I wouldn't had gotten the sass attack there :p
author: Jenny T.

description:
The remodeling of this place is awful. The layout of seating is awkward and feels cramped and the place has lost the warmth and community feel it had before. It just feels like a tiny corporate Starbucks you can find anywhere.

Before, this location was inviting to get a coffee and stand around,not necessarily inside. Now it just feels like a stop and go coffee shop. While this may make some business sense it doesn't when you realize of the context: The Castro is a people's neighborhood  not a financial center. People are out there to socialize and hang out, sit down and talk life. 

Clearly devised by clueless corporate clones, this 'new' Starbucks feels out of place in the Castro. Given the many other options for coffee around I wouldn't be surprised if business is already down.
author: Bartholomew F.

description: Nothing special about this Starbucks but I received a warm, genuine smile with my coffee. That's worth five stars any day.
author: Andrew S.

description:
I come here all the time. I work right down the street so it's pretty convenient.

I have to say, this is one of the best Starbucks in the city. They've remodeled it pretty recently, and it looks a lot nicer. The best thing about this location, though, is probably the staff. They're all very friendly and good at their jobs. Things move pretty quickly and I don't see any complaints from customers.This place is pretty clean, which is more than I can say for most locations (sorry Starbucks!).

The only small criticism I have is that it can get quite cramped and crowded pretty quickly in here. The space isn't too large and it may get difficult to maneuver around, yet somehow that has never stopped me from finding a place to sit and do work. You shouldn't have any trouble finding a place to sit most of the time, but if you just want to run in and grab something, then you shouldn't have any problems, as they are fast and polite.
author: Eric K.

description:
This Starbuck's located in the "HEART" of the Castro is like an old friend.   Always there when you need them!

The staff is friendly, and make your drink the way you ask for it with a smile.   

The eye candy and the feeling of being a piece of meat is extra, but hey your in the Castro right "wink * wink"!
author: Kevin W.

description:
I have yet to step inside since the remodeling.

But I do like coming here when I roam the Castro.
I will admit I hated the old layout, even though I've never sat inside to drink my coffee.
Looking at the pictures of the new layout it seems a lot nicer.

I always get great friendly service.
It's perfect to grab a cup of coffee if you're going to be standing in line at the Castro Theater.

Looking forward to seeing the new layout.
author: John S.

description: Worst customer service, uncomfortable atmosphere.  Especially rude brunette with glasses.
author: Steve F.

description: This place is awsome! The workers are super nice, they remember your name and your usual drink. Everyone is sweet and accommodating. I love coming here on my work days.
author: Kevin T.

description: Restin my bones before my appt. Not exactly my neighborhood but they leave me alone so Ill leave them alone as well. Homeless are less and its it not right on Castro. Meaning less travelers.
author: Crista S.

description: It's a Starbucks, no doubt about that. What helps set it apart is that all of the staff on my encounters have been very polite and on top of their orders. I come here every now and again when my bus is early. I'll be back. :)
author: Nicole F.

description: Ever since the remodel it's been really uncomfortable, they had 4 tiny tables at the bench, now only 3 for several months (it feels like they don't want customers there anymore, the rest is cafeteria style seating and some if the workers have a major attitude. This company is rebranding into what? I don't know. Several places have opened up in the area which is a nice feeling since this corporation puts places out of business. As caddy as it may sound I am glad they have some competition, I like to see small businesses have a chance
author: Mike R.

description:
This is my friendly neighborhood Starbucks... I mean BEARbucks. The staff is friendly and usually pretty fast. They know me and what I drink so ordering is easy. This is not your typical Starbucks - it's better because of the baristas... They're fun.

Downside: The place is tiny, so it isn't always a comfortable place to hang out.

Upside: The place is tiny, so you're really never more than a dozen steps from the beverage pick up counter.
author: Amy S.

description:
This Starbuck's location has almost nothing, nada, zip to do with coffee, but it almost everything to do with a group of large furry men spilling into and across the sidewalk with big dog's and expensive cars taking most nearby parking spaces all day thanks to dangling disabled placards that allow unlimited free parking for those smart enough to decide to obtain a placard, they're as related to disability as service animals these days, meaning they're abused to the point of laughability.  It is a busy, very busy Starbuck's location and very small which makes for cramped quarters for those who simply pass by and want a cup of Joe.

It reminds me of a European sidewalk cafe where a handful of old, tired men sit seemingly from here to eternity spending almost no money but asserting ownership of all the space surrounding and adjacent to the tiny coffee shop.  Inside you find the same kind of squatting and a computer is signed into Scruff or Grinder for hours on end while younger men cruise and connect but somehow hold onto their coveted space hour after hour.  It's an interesting cultural phenomena to want a place to sit where waiting is akin to expecting Muni to have a schedule.
author: Stu S.

description: Solid location, with quick and friendly staff. Only downside is that there isn't much room to do work since there is very limited table space.
author: Krish P.

description:
Starbucks for the most part has great service, and i got it when i came to this location after riding around with the Critical Mass bunch. 

the only thing is, that when i received my drink (very berry hibiscus refresher) it was a tad too watery, and there weren't any of those added raspberries other locations usually put in the cup. 

i was a little disappointed.

eh oh well.
author: Chelsea B.

description:
Commonly called Bearbuck's. This is where the  San Francisco bears, cubs, otters, wolves and all their admirers come to socialize and plan their days. A great place to wrap up the evening, and one rocking and rolling place on the weekends. The friendliest staff baristas will make your favorite beverages with smile and friendly banter. A day is not complete without tarting, finishinging or middle of the day beverage, or snack.
This is the best Starbucks in San Francisco!!!!
author: Robert R.

description: good place, fast wifi outlets are spacrce and limited seating, outlets are hard to access
author: Leigh G.

description: I find myself wandering into this starbucks on many occasions. Not only is it close to amazing restaurants and bars, but it's a very central location to get coffee you know is going to be pretty standard.
author: Andersen Y.

description: Cute and friendly baristas made my drink fast and well. It has been very busy each night I have been to this location. It's the only Castro starbucks. The smaller space is utilized well.
author: Sam D.

description:
One of the busiest Starbucks coffee shop 
I' ve ever seen! Small , but not for a down town! Very fast customer service! Yet to taste the coffee ..... hmm and the best coffee!
author: Bapu R.

description:
It's not the best Starbucks ever.  It's not the worst.  It's fine.  They don't have a warmer, so if you're a fan of any of the tasty foods that Starbucks cooks up in the oven or you like your morning bun or pumpkin warmed, you can't get 'em/it here.

If you can manage to get someone to abdicate their table, it's a nice place for a sit and chat, but tends to house some 'campers.'

On the plus side, this place as known as Bearbucks, Starbears, and a host of other hirsute names for a reason.  And that's one of the things I like about it.  Mwah.
author: Evan G.

description: Starbucks, ala "Bearbucks" to the locals for its more hirsute and/or beefy clientele, is what you'd expect from Starbucks. It's a smaller location, and there tends to be a lot of jockeying for the mezzanine seating where the power outlets are. There is a bench outside that's great for people watching, but due to city permit requirements there are no tables or chairs outside. The sidewalk tends to clog up with customers congregating and socializing and it is very active in the afternoon and early evening. The baristas are awesome and make every beverage the way it should be made.
author: Cory M.

description: Yuck! My frap was so sweet I couldn't even drink it! And I'm definitely not one to complain about my sweets! Although the staff was very friendly our drinks were not very good.
author: Danyell C.

description: So sad.  This used to be a fun place to hang out.  Now it's a soulless commercial Starbuck's , and there's better coffee just a few doors away in any direction.
author: Peter K.

description: I love this little spot fondly nicknamed "Bearbucks." It's a great place to run into friends on Saturday and Sunday. Only thing is they removed a lot of seating when they remodeled. I love the decor, but I do miss some of the seating.
author: Bradley V.

description:
Ahhhh, StarBears, how I love to walk past you and oggle all the cute, furry, beefy men out front, all the bears and cubs standing and posing with a wee bit of cappucino froth clinging to the bottoms of their mustaches...

And how I adore walking in, ordering my usual mocha-y beverage, hearing the barrista call back the drink to the register employee in his best RuPaul-esque intonation, then sitting down with a book or a friend, running into other friends who I only seem to run into while indulging in the Castro, enjoying the bubbly conversations flowing all around me...

It just feels....homey.  All that's missing is a small brick fireplace with a nice crackling fire!

Often, I'm the only female in there.  Normally, when I am the only woman in an all-male environment, I feel weirdly unsafe.  But that's never the case here.  The most attention I get might come in the form of a compliment on my choice of lipstick color or the fabulousness of my jewelry (and honey, my jewelry is ALWAYS fabulous!), and it's always polite.

This is not a Starbucks you go to if you are trying to find a Starbucks while driving around, not unless you have someone else in the car who can hop out and get your order, because finding parking in this neighborhood is beyond ridiculous, nearly impossible on some nights.  

And this is not a Starbucks you go to with a large group of friends - there just isn't much room, and what little seating there is is almost always completely full up.

While this location is technically WHEELCHAIR ACCESSIBLE, it's very difficult to navigate inside the awkward angle of the front entry, mostly because they often have furniture right there making it an uber-tight fit even for a smaller powerchair.  Scooters just won't fit, there isn't enough turn radius.  And after a person using a wheelchair orders, there's limited room to turn around, and little choice of where to hang out inside, because there are STAIRS to the level where most of the tables are.  Still, I believe they have a disabled-accessible bathroom - isn't that the Holy Grail?!

All in all, I enjoy this location immensely.  I don't go often, but when I'm in the Castro, I make a point!
author: Amy L.

description:
There is one thing that I love more than a cute Bear, and that's Coffee.  This location has both. 

Quality of Starbucks coffee is what it is.  The reason I prefer to go to this location over any other location, is a combination of things.

Here I feel safe with leaving my laptop for a minute or two to use the restroom, unlike the one by my apartment.  The barista's at this location ROCK.  They're super friendly, very accommodating, and from time to time they make me giggle with a joke that I'll overhear.  You can tell that they have developed great client relationships with the local clientele.  The location itself is a bit small, but I prefer to think of it as cozy.  With all 
the large men, it's like a cave den. 

I see how much the employees have to put up with, and I am shocked that they stay consistently happy & hard working.  

The only drawback for me, is the occasional smelly homeless person that gets a little to close for comfort, while I'm trying to respond to e-mails.  Definitely a white person problem, so no stars can be deducted for that.

Overall, this location rocks.  

Thanks Bearbucks!
author: Trevor B.

description:
The greatest experience you can ever have is this starbucks. They act like your family or friend. I am a regular for sure because everytime I go into this starbucks I feel like im in Seattle makes me feel at home. 

Sincerely,
Trente, Sweet Black Iced Tea 8 pumps
author: Jeremiah W.

description: Bearbucks ... the best in the castro to meet your furry friends .. and .. the staff is super friendly !
author: Nicolas D.

description:
I don't know that I've reviewed a Starbucks before but after visiting this one, I felt they deserved a nice review.  It was pouring rain and I came in and was welcomed into this cozy environment immediately by the guy behind the counter.  He was seriously so friendly that I wish this was my neighborhood Starbucks.  
I might have been a little happy that I got the Holiday BOGO deal only 10 minutes before it stopped too. :)
The setup inside was a little strange because of the seating arrangement.  It almost felt like you're on stage when you're placing your order.   There were tons of people inside working on their laptops and sipping coffee. It definitely seemed like a place locals hang out for long amounts of time.
author: Laurin A.

description: It's pretty easy to find parking early in the morning. It is  a nice space, but fairly small.
author: Tina F.

description:
This place was a great hangout for the neighborhood before they remodeled.  It is no longer Bearbucks aka Starbears. It now has all the warmth of an airport Starbucks.

I guess that they remodeled the place to be unwelcoming and uncomfortable in order to get people in and out.  They succeeded. I'm sure it's good for their bankbook, but It's just a shame that they turned their backs on the neighborhood.

The windows no longer open, and the air conditioning is often not working. There is even less room for the sugar/creamer table. The new outdoor benches are a joke.

This was a place I went to daily. Now it is just too uncomfortable.
author: gary y.

description: Thanks for nothing Starbucks.  The newly designed store is awful.  Looks like it was plucked from a Midwestern Airport and stuck into our historic neighborhood.  Bright enough to be seen from the moon.  If this is Starbucks idea of good design, we should all FIGHT the plans of yet another Starbucks at Market and Sanchez.  Starbucks owes this neighborhood better design.
author: EC N.

description: Might as well rename this place to "BEARBUCKS" instead. Other than that its no different from any other Starbucks.
author: Joe V.

description: This store is bitchy and has a lot of attitude.  But what else can you expect from a store known in the community as "StarBears"?  You'll get your signature drinks made here just like every other Starbucks throughout the world but expect a little longer of a wait because this store gets packed.  I'd walk across the street and try out Philz... better coffee hands down.
author: Kevin J.

description: The atmosphere is increasingly hostile. There's an increasing number of San Franciscan's and international travelers who come here who disregard the accepted norms of behavior for the community. It's in the middle of the Castro, heart of SF's gay community. A place where gay people should feel safe and accepted. This is one place we shouldn't have to deal with discrimination and harassment. Starbucks does nothing - they're happy to collect the money.
author: Lake Y.

description: Service at this Starbucks in particular is always top notch and baristas always make an effort to make an eye-to-eye contact when handing a drink out. That's always nice. Conveniently located on 18th Street! Less of a hangout after the remodel, if I do say so.
author: Austin P.

description: It's Starbucks coffee but ohhh the eye candy.  The baristas are friendly and fast.  I always enjoy good-looking men serving up some good coffee.  The only drawback is the place is somewhat small with limited amount of seating.
author: James E.

description:
This 'Bux is particularly friendly, and consistently packed (as others have suggested, seems to be particularly popular among the older, bearded dudes of the 'Stro... hence the nickname "Daddy Starbucks")... 

The store is oddly designed, e.g. if someone else is already at the mixing station, I'm forced to have one leg on a step and the other on the main floor as I cream-my-coffee. The design also doesn't have good capacity/flow to accommodate a long line, which, fortunately, I've never seen. (Ironically, the Peet's in Castro also has a particularly abnormal store layout.)

Basically, it's a Starbucks... it's what you'd expect... just a tad friendlier and with an odder store design.
author: Daniel P.

description: Small location, but incredibly nice customer service! Today I accidently said VENTi when I meant Grande, and they were really nice/understanding of my ditziness! They let it slide. I offered to pay for the Venti price anyway- point is they were really nice about it and it was much appreciated!
author: Kim D.

description:
Well I'm a huge fan of Starbucks, but this is the smallest one I've ever seen. It's like walking in a closet. There are way to many tables and chairs. You walk in, and it looks like people are sitting on top of one another... I'm not kidding about small. The customer service is awesome. These barista's are friendly and fun and def hold the place together. 

 They don't have warming, which is probably because of the amount of space in the store... so no breakfast sandwiches, and no hot lunch sandwiches. Very sad. Thats the major reason I gave two stars. I went hoping for a breakfast sandwich to start my day... and I got a muffin instead. Booooo
author: Jason L.

description:
I walked out of this place without doing business. 

Line out the door...but it's Starbucks, it's expected. 

What got me is the fact that they have a sign on their door saying no animals allowed, and what do I see? Someone taking their dog in. Any animal (except service animals) should not be allowed in any establishment that sells food. Strike one

Strike two, an employee stocking food items, items later to be purchased be people for consumption, is petting the dog, letting it lick his hand, then continues stocking food without washing his hands.

Strike three...and the kicker...this said employee then heads back to make coffee...what doesn't he do? Wash his hands...So if you want a long line for dog slobber on your fruit parfait and dog hair in your coffee...go here...I'm not.
author: Garrett B.

description: Least favorite starbucks in the whole city. I like to call it the social security office,  because there's always people there! All day, everyday, just staring at you like your a piece of meat. Will gay men ever come up to you and ask you out? Nope, it's got to be through some stupid app for them to say "hello." Always crowded, and no where to sit. I only buy something here when I have to use the bathroom, because god knows how impossible it is to find a bathroom in the Castro.
author: Gabriel T.

description: This is my favorite Starbucks in the city. The crew are so friendly and are always on top of it! It could get busy and crowded sometimes but that is because the crew is so awesome. And it is also in a busy part of town.
author: steph t.

description:
I honestly have nothing bad to say about this store.

I used to work for Starbucks and this store is probably one of the best I've ever been to AND they're consistent. I come there a few times a year and the same thing happens. I arrive some time in the morning, order my drink from a very friendly cashier while the barista chimes in to get my order and within a minute or two, I have my drink being delivered to where ever I'm sitting in the store. Wow. That does NOT happen in NY. I love me some NYC, but some of those Starbucks partners out there leave more to be desired and do not represent the Starbucks Coffee I know it's supposed to be.

Bearbucks, as most call this location, is a nice spot. Patrons and employees are friendly and it's a great location to get coffee'd up before you hit the bars...which are across the street. =)
author: Vincent R.

description: Bearbucks Castro izzzz BACK but I hate to say that the seating capacity has NOT improved.  I was there Sept 15 and the interiors were ummmmm nice however the new spanking arrangements looks awkward.   But I do give credit that when you go into place an order drink that you are basically loop in and on right out.  Bathroom facility is in the front vs the back where it once was and the seating arrangements outside looks fugly.  The ol hangout mood it once was has definitely died.
author: Jake M.

description: The drinks are great. Staff is friendly. Environment is too busy! Finding a seat is rare. Not a good study place or quiet area. But good if you want to socialize. Customers are very friendly here.
author: Hin M.

description:
Call me a naive straight girl, but I had no idea this Starbucks was a bear hangout. I often go to yoga in the neighborhood and back when I used to work in the east bay, I would come to this Starbucks and hang out before class. Sure I noticed a lot of guys there, but it was the Castro. Occasionally I would notice guys who were obviously on an early date and were doing the coffee-date-first-to-see-if-we-want-a-second-date thing. I always liked the fact that people left me pretty much alone. Upon reflection, being female, small, and decidedly un-hairy probably helped significantly.

LBGT reading material and hairy patrons aside, this is a Starbucks like you'd find anywhere else worldwide, love it or hate it. Go Bears!
author: Megan K.

description: As long as you don't mind walking the gauntlet of bears (grrrr, swat!) and guys on Grindr then this is the Bearbucks for you.  You'll find it complete with everything else you'd expect at a regular Starbucks...only furrier.
author: Sean H.

description: I went tonight for a mocha.  It was a little chalky tasting but it was good.  $3.80 for a venti (that's Italian for large).  I think the price should be half that considering the volume they do.  3 stars translates to "A-OK", so I'll give them 3 stars this time.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
I like my hot chocolate like I like my men: tall, rich, and able to keep me cozy when the weather gets cold. 

As someone who drinks a good 4-5 cups of hot cocoa a week, I dig any coffee place that really gets it right. The majority of cafes tend to overlook the chocolate drinks and water them down. What the hell? If I wanted watery hot cocoa, I'd dump a teaspoon of Hershey's syrup into a cup of hot water and call it a day. (Peet's I am looking at you!) 

Starbucks knows what it's doing with the hot cocoa. I don't care if their coffee is over-roasted or if they're a great example of commercialism running amok. What I DO care about is that they took my favorite drink and turned the amplifier up to 11. Their hot chocolate is good, but their seasonal Signature Hot Chocolate....omg. Let me die happy in chocolaty orgasmic bliss now. 

An analogy: 

A good guy is one that is tall, handsome, funny, treats his girl well, has no serious issues, and is decent in bed. 

A great guy is one that your friends tell you to shut up because no they don't care that he has a dimple only on one side of his face and that he plans on being a millionaire by 30 but only after spending three years working in a non profit saving little babies and they really don't want to hear about that night in the hotel room with the removable shower head. 

I have found my perfect hot cocoa, and I get my fix from Starbies frequently because of it. Perfect guy? Definitely not at this location, though if I were 20 years older and 200 lbs heavier not to mention a dude, I'd be on the right track. No stallions here - just a lot of bears.
author: Devon S.

description:
Ahh bearbucks, I always have two types of times here.

1. When I'm either by myself or with a friend, we always have a good time, the barista's are friendly and accomodating. I usually never get bothered, I'm guessing that's since I'm usually the only girl born a girl there. It's a great place to sit and people watch- I love hearing the outlandish coffee related pick up lines. "I like my coffee and metal black, just like my men"

and then there's experience #2.
(Note to self: DON'T go into this starbucks with your father)
Whenever I go in with my dad, I end up being his wing-girl. And since he's a beard-clad, hairy "daddy" bear, this makes things a bit awkard. Whenever I'm there with him, I always get the, "Oh honey, is this gorgeous man your father? I wish he was MY daddy" 

and of course I smile, laugh and take large gulps of my Carmel Apple Spice, trying to scald the awkward weird visions of my father and his suitors from my brain. (focus on the carmel-ey deliciousness, Laurel, focus)

so for all the kids who have bear dad's... I suggest avoiding this place with your parent's, unless you want a very awkward situation. Otherwise, feel free to enjoy it on your own. I know I do!
author: Laurel Y.

description:
I remember when I was living in the Midwest and there was a Starbucks opening up in my small town.  We were becoming metropolian and had something to brag about.  This was 12 years ago. 
-----
Fast Forward
-----
Remember that scene in Beetlejuice, where Beetlejuice has to wait in line in the afterlife--there is a guy with a shrunken head, a guy who smoked too much, a woman sawed in half, etc...
Here is a pic to help ya remember: 
http://www.conecultachiapas.gob.mx/noticias/imagenes/982006_0914_beetlejuice294.jpg

This is what starbucks has become.
author: Bill B.

description: This is the Castro's "Bearbucks" so expect large hairy men and often, superhero costumes.  Lots of camping. Several seats have power.
author: Dave B.

description: One of my favorite Starbucks in the city, as it doesn't really feel "corporate" for some reason.  Maybe it's the odd shape of the place, or the super-gay staff and customers, but it has more of a neighborhood feel than some of the supposedly indie coffee shops nearby, at least for me.
author: Joyce J.

description:
Typically I think Starbucks will be the same across the board as far as the product you're getting.  The staff can make all the difference, obviously.  This staff is consistently friendly and welcoming and sometimes they even call me by my first name.  There's something to be said for that sort of personalized experience...even if it IS just a tall coffee and a pumpkin scone =)
Ooh, and the bears?  I'm not typically into that 'type' of guy, but I admit they make it more fun and I like being around them none the less, haha
author: West P.

description: I've been coming here for ages.  If you want a quick carry-out, it's standard Starbuck's and you can't go wrong.  But if you're looking for a pleasant place to work or have a conversation with a friend, don't come here.  They remodeled this location recently and the seating is very congested and uncomfortable.  (Reminds me of the gate area of a Southwest flight the day before Thanksgiving.)  Can't really blame Starbuck's, because they don't have a lot of space to work with and they are doing the best they can.  I come by for a hot chocolate now and then, and I get in and out as fast as possible before the claustrophobia kicks in.
author: Dan L.

description:
I love Starbucks and Castro, but for this location they are always hiring ULTRA mean and impolite bitches.

If you like a Naomi-Campbell-attitude from the cashier - yes! CASHIER -  sure go for it.
Girl, you got zero stars from me cause you are mean-mean-mean!
author: P.H. D.

description:
Why are you so insanely wonderful? Why?!

I go to this Starbucks, like far too often. It's almost like a marriage at times. They will see me there every Wednesday, like clock-work, at approximately 4:50 or so. Gotta get my cup of coffee before doing my volunteer work.

Here's the thing...every fag in the 'Stro comes here in the morning. Well, I mean not EVERY fag...but a good number. And when I am staying at a friends the night before, I come here to grab a coffee before getting on the train. Line out the door! But you know what? They are never slow, regardless of the amount of orders. I saw someone a few people in front of me order four drinks at once. BAM! They had them ready in no time.

I especially love all the local art work on the walls, and how friendly they are with everyone that comes in, regular folks or not. And, how can you not love this place for all the hot and hairy bears sitting outside? Nice. Me likey a lot.

My only qualm (and this is not anything to do with the employees really...) is that this Starbucks doesn't have the breakfast sandwiches. How do ya expect me to start my morning without a breakfast sandwich? Tell the bitches at corporate to pass ya'll a warmer oven. Then it'd be all 5-star quality goodness for ya'll. :D
author: Nicolas H.

description: The remodel is aesthetically-pleasing but is worse in almost every other aspect.  Clearly, the corporate top brass wanted to eliminate table space.  Awful layout - completely eliminated the community feel.  Hot as f#%* in there constantly.
author: Nicholas P.

description:
Best Starbucks ever!  Warm, friendly staff and great mix of people 

It's still called StarBears (Bearbucks?) with all the Bears hanging around on the sidewalk in front.  I'm in here all the time and always enjoy watching the locals and non alike.
author: Michael-ji N.

description: This place has amazing service. I had to order a ton of coffee for an event at the last minute, and not only were they happy to accommodate, but one of the staff members even helped me carry everything back to our office a block away. Wonderful gents!
author: Aaron K.

description: It's there, that's it. Nothing particularly special about this location other than some of the more unique customers. The store seems very dirty and shabby to me. A few of the employees are nice and may know your name or what drinks you like but you can really find that anywhere. And some of the other employees can just be flat out rude. Overall the store just seems generic and run down to me. Homeless people regularly come and go and the bathroom is a major attraction.
author: L. A.

description:
I live in this area and barely noticed there was a Starbucks close by, This is so convenient for me. The staff is so friendly, and so are the customers that occupy their time here doing whatever they do. It is a lively area so if you like it to be quiet, this is not the place. See, I like to study my nursing in these kinds of places so it's perfect for me. 

What did it for me was how i left my phone charger here 2 days ago, and they had it saved for me bc someone turned it in. Who does that nowadays???!!! Good people I must say. It is also very clean, including the bathroom. Since it is in the Castro, there are many good looking men that come in here.. Eye Candy for me as I study and sip on my beverage :) 

I definitely recommend this place for anyone local in the area and looking for a friendly atmosphere.
author: Brenda S.

description:
It's like a zoo.
I was stunned when I moved into the neighborhood.
All these old men, all these hairy men, all these hefty men.
Run goldilocks, run!

Now as for the inside, DO NOT Go into the Bathroom.
It's like a gas station in Beirut.

But if you're here for some joe, soy or cider, oh they make a good cider, then you're in luck and I have driven past quite a few smaller 
shops for it.
Why?
Cause with chains you get consistency and in this shop you also get very friendly service.
author: Sean S.

description: This place is a gold mine for starbucks and bear lovers :)
author: Matt V.

description:
The one thing about all the Starbucks in the world is that you can rely on the same roast and flavor. It may not be the most interesting, but it is nothing if not consistent.

What changes are the people that go to different locations. I love my Seattle Olive Way Gaybucks, but this tops it because it was the original Pasqua Bear World Pick Up Mess that became Bearbucks.

Essentially, it's where a lot of the hairy, bearded guys go for coffee. Fun, if you like that. The whole sloppy bear thing is amusing, and I have gotten dates at this location, which I cannot say for my Gaybucks in Seattle.

Maybe it's because when you're the new blend, everyone wants a taste?

Right?
author: Bill F.

description: Came in after a long day; 11pm after A Castro show of "A Clockwork Orange" or something along those lines, I went to get a tall $1.50 de-caf and it only took seconds after I ordered! Piping hot and freshly brewed! THe cashiers was so nice and the vie is so laid back and it was awesome!
author: R C.

description:
OK, I've been in a lot of Starbucks and yes this one is unique in that non-pleasing way.

1) It's totally cramped.  The padded benches for cuddling with your beau are cool, but they take up way too much room.  Oh and you'll almost *have* to excuse yourself when you try to cram through the oddly-cornered entrance.

2) Hardly any power outlets.  C'mon ppl!

3) Stanky.  Not stinky, stanky.  The bathroom is dirty and has a strange odor.

The crowd is lively and fun.  They don't call it Bearbucks for nothing.
author: Amy L.

description:
The staff always friendly and helpful, even at the busiest of times.  

Say what you will about "corporate chain stores" but this one feels m

As Starbucks go, this one is my favorite.
author: Moby D.

description:
I have to say that since Star Bucks which is now known as Bear Bucks in the castro has gone down hill with service! The employees are not to blame I have actually ask around and many friends have said that this has been the same at all loctations all overthe states! 
The thing is that we used to go there and the line would move so fast , well now since they updates their stores with new boards, machines and all well they have told their employees to SLOW DOWN  and make them wait!! the reason u may ask ! well its so u will read their boards , new menu and also look at the fresh food they have and maybe they will get you to buy more,,, They used to have such great service and be so good but sorry MANGEMENT of Starbuck this is a REALLY BAD IDEA people are their to get in and out not to hang out otherwsie they would grab a table .. many friends have gone to PHILZ down the road which I have to say has better coffee and its made one cup at a time... Again This has nothing to do with the employees of starbucks its what they were told to do and to keep their jobs now a days u do what your told ... GO figure Starbucks ...
I went to Starbucks this am waited 20 minutes in line  for the same cup that would normally take 5min, They had 1 person doing register and one coffee maker, I spoke to manager and comlained, she said they have been told to do ONE cup at a time now , and trust me thats why I saw,, SlowBucks this is wrong ,new computer system and new style is all wrong ..
author: Randy M.

description: This is by far one of the best Starbucks I know of.  Everyone is very friendly. I've enjoyed many great experiences here.
author: Brian C.

description:
Ah, Bearbucks.

Often times, there are more people hanging out outside since this place is so teenyWEENYitsyBITSY.
author: Jeff P.

description: Bears and coffee make me feel warm and fuzzy... life is good.
author: Eddie Y.

description: 2.5 stars. The wifi is way too slow even if there's nobody here! Otherwise, it's the same old starbucks you'd find anywhere, except with courteous baristas.
author: Daniel C.

description: Being a local Castro resident and merchant, I often frequent this location. I have never been helped by such friendly staff. Many of the staff know me by name and will often ask me as I come in If I'd like my usual so that it's ready by time I reach the counter. In the multitude of visits I've made to this location they have only had one small mistake on my order ever, which they immediately rectified and supplied me with a coupon for a free drink on my next order. I always have a smile on my face after leaving this place.
author: Victor P.

description: Apart from the fact that that it is super small this is my favorite Starbucks. With Starbucks you know what you ate going to get with the food and drinks so what sets each one apart is the staff and clientele. Both are great here. The staff always smile and are pleasant, they have memorized my typical order, and this might seem small but they spell my name correctly on the cup. I LOVE THAT. I also like going in and getting stares from all the gay guys who hang out there. Bearbucks rules!
author: Steven W.

description:
Great location.  Not many seats.
My friend thinks the guy behind the cash wrap is pretty cute!
I think he looks like jason schwartzman!
Lots of bears to see.
Definitely a place where I do not mind hanging out at.  People watching at its best!
author: Elisa O.

description:
I always order the same drink: Venti Earl Grey tea, one inch off the top, two bags, and a shot of soy milk on the side.

I wince every single time I order this. The fine folks at this Starbucks never do. Seems the pickier you are, the nicer they become. Go fig.
author: Matt Y.

description: The staff at this Starbucks is always friendly and always willing to offer options and tips to save money.
author: Kevin S.

description: I don't normally have much to say about SB... but this is a very cool and interesting one!  It has a totally unique vibe.  There are always people here, day and night, inside and out. Very interesting people! A great people watching spot. The staff is very nice and many of them are quite attractive too. The espresso is better than a lot of other locations. They are very fast. The bathroom is absolutely grosstastic. I come here a lot because they are nice and the hours are the best.
author: Aaron W.

description: The veritable "Bearbucks" or "Starbears", this is the one Starbucks that attracts a gaggle of bearish men pretty much any time of day, any day of the week.  Any other Starbucks would qualify for 2 stars....Peets would get 4.  I'm not really a fan of chains or coffee or coffee chains, but if you're looking for bears in the Castro, this is the spot.
author: Don O.

description:
I HATE Starbucks Espresso drinks - Sorry, I think its gross, and those machines they have make the drinks WORSE.

HOWEVER......

I like the staff - they are quite interesting mix, and know their shit. They also have a knack of looking similar (are they all related), in hairstyle and facial hair. Not that it has ANYTHING to do with service.

Okay, so Bearbucks or StarBears - either way you call it, there is a ton of Bears here, and bear chasers. Its kinda also a place where cute little geeky boys who wear glasses and read books go, matter of fact, thats all thats here today. Bears are outside. 

There isnt much room to sit, and most of the places are taken anyway, so might as well make a friend, ask to sit with them, and strike up a conversation. 

The drinks however (non-espresso based) are some of the best made in the city - they know how to do it. They are the ONLY Starbucks in the Castro proper, and the only one Id walk to from here anyway - so you know its gonna be good. The only reason they have 4 stars and not 5 is that I feel the WIDE selection of drinks they have as a whole, arent worthy of my time. Just the NON-ESPRESSO ones (Pike Place Roast Coffee is THE BOMB!).

Ask for the Captain Crunch Berries Frap.
author: William D.

description: I have been here a couple other times and it's always been packed, it's a very small Starbucks. My experience with the staff was great, they were very pleasant and my coffee was very good. This is THE Castro coffee shop to hang out in and to go to if you want to be looked at. Boys Town has theirs as do most neighborhoods. If I am in the Castro walking around it will be the coffee shop I go to.
author: Russell D.

description: Okay....its a Starbucks but this isn't any Starbucks...the one in the heart of the Castro. The staff is always very friendly. The food is fresh and ample. The coffee is great.......If you need a pick me up before hitting the district or as an in between bar pick me up, this is the place to get it. There is free WiFi and seating is adequate. They encourage fund raising for different charities.
author: Pierce B.

description: This Starbucks is another example of how tight some spaces are in the Castro (and all of SF). While the layout may not create the best traffic flow, the service is always friendly. If you're lucky enough to grab a seat inside or out, treasure it, as they're a hot commodity.
author: Mrk P.

description: The quality of Starbucks coffee is going down. I suspect that they are using lower quality beans and serving old and long heated coffee.
author: Munch M.

description: I like this one in particular especially super early in the morning. I came here this morning around 6am and it was warm and not so crowded inside. The staff were really friendly and I was able to enjoy my hot chocolate and chocolate croissant peacefully and quietly. It is so much better when it's not crowded.
author: Mel P.

description: The concrete benches outside aren't the least bit comfortable, but if you're in the market for a hairy man with your grande nonfat, decaf, sugar-free frappalattemochaccino, they provide a front row seat for the best bear-watching in town.
author: Gourmet G.

description: Did I somehow land in Denali National Park and Preserve?  Bears and cubs, oh my!  Although I came here to get a latte in the morn, you will instead be treated to a healthy population of wildlife - some of them like to sniff you out to see if you are delicious enough to eat (while I'm doing a little sniffing around myself).  Looking around, there were definitely some that possibly looked too hot to handle, just like my latte.  I just slip on a protective cardboard sleeve, add 1 pkg of that sweet, fake goodness and I'm good to go.
author: Roger R.

description: This is the smallest Starbucks EVER, but I must say, the person that made my Triple Grande Soy Caramel Macchiato was paying attention when I said "Triple."
author: Janet R.

description: My favorite Starbucks.  The staff are friendly, the place is clean, the toilets are clean and they always get my order right.  The only negatives are that there is never anywhere to sit and all the bears eat the best baked goods before I get there.
author: Michael D.

description: I love this Starbucks.  The staff is SUPER friendly and it has a very nice neighborhood feel to it.  KUDOS!
author: Sean L.

description: Nothing special really about this Starbucks, except for the fact that some guys "woof"ed at me today after getting coffee there.  Oh, Castro, how I love thee!
author: David M.

description: I'm sorry to say that Starbucks is overrated and the tall americanos I had here have been weak and uninspiring, to my disappointment.   I have mixed feelings about the staff too, unfortunately.  So I avoid going here all together.  I love that men of a certain persuasion and their dogs hang outside the shop.  And whenever I walk pass the crowded sidewalk I can almost feel a gang b*ng coming.  Down boy.
author: Errol F.

description:
thanks to my friend b, the starbucks addict (no, really, he is.), i've been to sooo many starbucks in the city and in fact, wherever i go with him. i cant remember all the locations. this one i remember, because it's in my neighborhood. friendly service. usual starbucksiness.  i dont like coffee but i liked the white chocolate mocha latte with soy that b showed me, till one of my other friends told me it has a million calories. now im scared to go back. 
People sit outside during the day to castro watch. i never have... but maybe you want to.
author: Merredith L.

description: This is the third starbucks that I am reviewing on. Cool, a truly starcbucks experience=)
author: Laics C.

description: Daddy Bear Central. This former Pasqua is an oxymoron--an interesting Starbucks.
author: Jim G.

description: I really enjoy this Starbucks (Bearbucks) always friendly staff and pretty consistant drink quality...yeah it's on the smallish side but it works.  Kudos to the baristas that have given me free goodies from time to time :-)
author: Denny R.

description:
i have gone here since before it was a starbucks (there was a local coffeehouse chain, pasqua, that was bought up by starbucks).  the baristas address me by name even though i'm not a particularly regular customer (only a few times each week).  

imho, this isn't so much a bearbucks anymore, but i'm good with that.  i wish they had more indoor seating (over the years they've reclaimed some seating space for use as storage).  the beverages are, of course, starbucks standard ... sometimes it's ok to not be surprised by something.
author: Henry M.

description: Ahh bearbucks, I usually only go here if I feel like Peets is too far of a walk simply because I think Peets' coffee tastes better and gives me more of a caffeinated feeling, but I honestly have no complaints about this starbucks.  All of their staff is friendly, the place is always clean, and they service customers very quickly and efficiently.  I tried the ginger spiced lattee the other day that some random woman gave me because she had an extra and I actually really enjoyed it, I never thought ginger would be good like that.  Normally I am a coffee/hot chocolate person, but I would definitely like to try the pumpkin spice lattee now since I liked the ginger so much.
author: Jonathan M.

description: This place irritates me!  Why, when there are so many local places to go,  must all these people have to decide to hang out here?  Yes, yes, we know... it's not about the coffee.  But really, it's just wrong when there are so many great local joints with in 2 minutes distance.   I don't care how many cute guys are hanging out there!   Oh yes -- Harvey Milk would have pushed you off the curb!
author: Maureen V.

description: I am normally not a fan of Starbucks but out of any in the city this is my favorite. The staff is really friendly and I live up the street so I not only see them in Starbucks but on the bus, and at my school...and they are always nice. I don't really go to Starbucks unless I need to use my card, because everywhere else is cash only. But the other day one of the guys outside grunted and winked at my boyfriend, we both laughed and went on our caffeinated way. I love the guys outside just as much as the staff (I actually give them 5 stars for not thinking I am strange for petting their dog and telling him what a pretty pup he was).
author: Jessica G.

description: This is my favorite Starbucks in The City.  I love the "Bear Jamboree" on Sunday afternoons.  This is a great place to hang out on a warm day and check out all the cute Boys.
author: Carlos C.

description: As I had stated previously, in my review for Spike's, I am not against corporate coffee.  However, I  like this Starbucks.   The staff is always friendly, and I've seen a full cross section of the GLBT community here, and that's always a positive thing.
author: Carlos C.

description: I have always liked Starbucks Coffee. Also, I like their scones, specially the lemon/poppy -seed scone. This store has friendly staff, and you can see all types of people there. It is anoying that sometimes the bench outside is all taken by the homeless which can scare people away.
author: carlos f.

description: there is not really enough i can say about this starbucks. not only does it have an outdoor seating area right on 18th street (i love that) but it also has the greatest baristas working there. sure, there are a LOT of sbux in the city to go to. this one has limited parking, and is not easy to get to! unless you are already in castro of course. i go out of my way to go to this one, and i actually pass another sbux on my way. the people that work here are SO friendly! i go in like 3 times a week. i dont think thats very often, and STILL they remember my name. thats amazing! i even change up my drink! i dont know how they do it. a prime example of how all starbucks should operate!
author: Ryan B.

description: it made me happy to walk into this starbucks. one thing though bathroom very icky.. i wonder why.. anywho the baristas were nice and told me where to go since i told them  i was from sd
author: Brad B.
